SEARCH
Package game.core

Class GameSound

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.SoundClip
game.core.GameSound
public class GameSound extends city.cs.engine.SoundClip
A class that extending SoundClip and is used to handle the game sounds.
Has additional features such as volume control, global volume control, and delayed playing.
Since:
17-03-2025
Author:
Alexander Smolowitz, alexander.smolowitz@city.ac.uk

    Creates a new sound with a specific duration.

    forcedPlay()
    If sounds is already playing, creates a duplicate instance and calls play() on it.
    static double

    Gets the global volume level.

    Gets the local volume level of this sound instance.

    Plays a sound after a specified delay.
    static void
    setGlobal(double volume)
    Sets the global volume for all sounds.
    void
    setVolume(double volume)
    Sets the volume of the sound.
    If the volume is set to 0, which triggers an IllegalArgumentException, the volume is set to 0.0001.
    There is nothing to catch an IllegalArgumentException of a volume set too high, as the volume is restricted by the volume slider in JMenuPanel.
    void
    stop()
    Stops the sound if it is playing.

  • Method Details

    • createSound

      public static GameSound createSound(String path, SoundGroups group, boolean loops)
      Creates a new looping sound.
      Parameters:
      path - Path to the sound file.
      group - The sound group to add the sound to.
      loops - Whether the sound should loop.
      Returns:
      A new GameSound instance.

    • createSound

      public static GameSound createSound(String path, SoundGroups group, int duration)
      Creates a new sound with a specific duration.
      Parameters:
      path - Path to the sound file.
      group - The sound group to add the sound to.
      duration - Duration of the sound in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      A new GameSound instance.

    • playOnDelay

      public static void playOnDelay(GameSound sound, int delayMs)
      Plays a sound after a specified delay.
      Parameters:
      sound - The GameSound instance to play.
      delayMs - Delay in milliseconds before playing the sound.

    • forcedPlay

      public void forcedPlay()
      If sounds is already playing, creates a duplicate instance and calls play() on it.

    • play

      public void play()
      Plays the sound if it is not already playing.
      Overrides:
      play in class city.cs.engine.SoundClip

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the sound if it is playing.
      Overrides:
      stop in class city.cs.engine.SoundClip

    • setVolume

      public void setVolume(double volume)
      Sets the volume of the sound.
      If the volume is set to 0, which triggers an IllegalArgumentException, the volume is set to 0.0001.
      There is nothing to catch an IllegalArgumentException of a volume set too high, as the volume is restricted by the volume slider in JMenuPanel.
      Overrides:
      setVolume in class city.cs.engine.SoundClip
      Parameters:
      volume - (double) The volume level to set.

    • setGlobal

      public static void setGlobal(double volume)
      Sets the global volume for all sounds.
      Parameters:
      volume - The global volume level to set.

    • isPlaying

      public boolean isPlaying()
      Returns true if the sound is currently playing.
      Returns:
      true if the sound is playing, false otherwise.

    • getGlobalVolume

      public static double getGlobalVolume()
      Gets the global volume level.
      Returns:
      (double) The global volume level.

    • getVolume

      public double getVolume()
      Gets the local volume level of this sound instance.
      Returns:
      (double) The local volume level.
